summary: REQUIRES HEARTHFIRE AND SKYRIM UPDATE. This is a small cabin home. Includes a Kitchen, Dining Room, converted-attic bedroom for 2 children, Master bedroom, Bathroom and a Basement.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][u][color=#ff0000]>>>HEARTHFIRE AND SKYRIM UPDATE IS REQUIRED.<<<[/color]
[/u][/size]
[size=3][u]-10/12/14  9:50am UPDATE; I will be working on adding more interactive display cases and weapons displays and I will also add a stable outside.[/u]   I am having issues with the house now... even though my teleport marker is above the ground I keep clipping through the floor... might let someone else take over if they are interested...[/size]


Windhelm Cabin is a small cosy home for a small family. The home includes;

-Kitchen
-Dining Room
-A bedroom for up to 2 children, converted from an attic space!
-A bathroom located to the left of the kitchen
-Master bedroom for dragonborn and spouse.
-Basement with Enchanting and Alchemy station and PLENTY OF STORAGE!

Windhelm Cabin also has all the crafting stations you need, they are located on the exterior of the house. 

[u][b][size=5]INSTALLATION:

[/size][/b][/u]Please bare with me, I am relatively new to modding and I'm not quite sure how Nexus Mod Manager works... I have included all Meshes required in a folder called 'Riverwoodcabin.esp' and I thought that if I changed the name it might screw up the path that the game uses to find the items... so I left it at that. If you don't use Nexus Mod Manager, all you have to do is drop the 'Riverwoodcabin.esp' file into your TEXTURES folder that is located in the Skyrim DATA folder. After that you can drop 'novafoxay_cabinhome' plugin into the DATA folder and enable it through the Skyrim plugin menu. I'm sorry if the explaination is terrible, I'm relatively new, hopefully manager will sort it out for you!

As far as I know there aren't any issues with this mod. I went through the entire house several times to make sure there were no holes in the walls etc and I also got my boyfriend to test it for me so that I could make sure there weren't any missing items as well.
author: Rachel Turner
